intro: Mystacidium spicatum, commonly known as the spike moss, is a type of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy shoot system, and its leaves are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It reproduces through spores, which are released from small, cup-like structures called soridia. Mystacidium spicatum plays an important role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
